etymologies: Middle English; earliest use found in Trinity Cambridge Manuscript. From spouse + -hood

definitions: The state or fact of being a spouse, or of being married; matrimony, marriage; wedlock.

notes.text: rare between the 16th and late 19th centuries.

definitions: The position or status of the Church, or a person (especially a member of a female religious order) or soul, regarded as being symbolically married to God or Christ; the union or bond so characterized.
